briefTitle: FAPO-2: Cardiac Patient Monitoring Tool for Clinical Observation and Arrhythmia Detection
officialTitle: FAPO-2: Cardiac Patient Monitoring Tool for Clinical Observation and Arrhythmia Detection

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

primary.measure: Incidence and number of Atrial Fibrillation (AF) events detected
primary.description: Incidence and total number of AF events detected, stratified by study group and device type (smartwatch, portable Holter). This allows assessment of AF detection rate across different monitoring protocols and devices during the follow-up period.
primary.timeFrame: During the monitoring period for each group, as specified (14-45 days depending on group)

primary.measure: Number of critical health alerts generated by the FAPO-SI³ platform
primary.description: Alerts categorized by physiological parameter: blood pressure (BP), heart rate (HR), and oxygen saturation (SpO₂). Mean clinical response time to alerts will be calculated per patient during their respective monitoring period, allowing assessment of platform responsiveness and clinical workflow efficiency.
primary.timeFrame: During the monitoring period for each group, as specified (14-45 days depending on group)

primary.measure: Patient risk classification generated by the AI model
primary.description: Distribution of patients across AI-generated risk categories (e.g., low, moderate, high) based on physiological and biometric data collected from the smartwatch and portable Holter system during the monitoring period.
primary.timeFrame: During the monitoring period for each group, as specified (14-45 days depending on group)

secondary.measure: Patient risk classification generated by the AI model
secondary.description: Distribution of patients across AI-generated risk categories adapted from the Manchester Triage System. The algorithm will classify patients into risk levels (e.g., immediate, very urgent, urgent, standard, non-urgent) based on physiological and biometric data collected from the smartwatch and portable Holter system during the monitoring period.
secondary.timeFrame: During the monitoring period for each group, as specified (14-45 days depending on group)

secondary.measure: Adverse events related to device use
secondary.description: Incidence of device-related adverse events including skin lesions (MARSI), allergic reactions, and discomfort (graded using validated scales) reported during the monitoring period.
secondary.timeFrame: From enrollment through the monitoring period, up to 45 days depending on study group

dataSource: ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 - Ultimate Complete Collection
